data.title: List of 44 Tim Curry Movies & TV Shows, Ranked Best to Worst
data.meta_description: What are the greatest Tim Curry movies & TV shows of all time?
data.text:
This ranking is based on an algorithm that combines various factors, including the votes of our users and search trends on the internet.

List of Tim Curry Movies: Ranked Best To Worst

1. Video Stars (1983)

9

3

9

3

Role:

Teddy Whazz

Starring:

Patrick Malahide, John Bird, Roger Lloyd Pack, Nicholas Ball

Directed By:

Colin Bucksey

2. The Hunt for Red October (1990)

36

12

PG

36

12

At the height of the Cold War, Soviet submarine captain Marko Ramius, commanding the latest nearly undetectable nuclear missile submarine Red October, defies orders and sets course for America's east coast. After its presence is briefly detected, Jack Ryan, CIA analyst and former Marine, is given three days to confirm his theory that Ramius plans to defect.

Directed By:

John McTiernan

3. The Rocky Horror Picture Show (1975)

38

10

R

38

10

The movie follows the newly engaged Brad Majors and Janet Weiss who find themselves trapped in the castle of Dr. Frank-N-Furter, a transvestite scientist from Transsexual, Transylvania. As they lose their innocence, Frank creates a man named Rocky. Frank is later revealed to be an alien and his servants revolt to free the prisoners.

Role:

Dr. Frank-N-Furter - A Scientist

Starring:

Meat Loaf, Susan Sarandon, Christopher Biggins, Barry Bostwick, Patricia Quinn, Richard O'Brien

Directed By:

Jim Sharman

4. Clue (1985)

29

8

PG

29

8

After arriving at the secluded New England mansion of Mr. Boddy, six strangers are greeted by the butler Mr. Wadsworth and assigned secret identities. It is soon revealed that all of them are being blackmailed by Mr. Boddy. But when Boddy ends up murdered soon after, all six becomes suspects.

Role:

Wadsworth

Starring:

Lesley Ann Warren, Christopher Lloyd, Eileen Brennan, Michael McKean, Madeline Kahn

Directed By:

Jonathan Lynn

15

6

TV-MA

15

6

Kinsey is a 2004 biographical drama film, which gives us a glimpse of the life of the Alfred Kinsey, a pioneer in the area of human sexuality.

Bill Condon

20

Muppet Treasure Island is an action adventure musical comedy film which revolves around a young orphan named Jim who join Kermit, and set out with his friends on a quest to find a treasure hidden on a remote island. They soon face off against a gang of heartless pirates.

10. Home Alone 2: Lost in New York (1992)

56

22

PG

56

22

Kevin McCallister and his family plan a Christmas vacation in Miami but Kevin accidentally boards a wrong plane and lands in New York, where he befriends a toy shop owner and a homeless pigeon lady. Also in New York are his old foes, Harry and Marv, who plan to burgle the toy store. Kevin of course is ready to trap and hand them back to the police.

Directed By:

Chris Columbus

18

6

PG

18

6

A young orphan who lives in an orphanage believes that her parents left her there by mistake. Eventually, a rich man named Oliver lets her live at his home to improve his image. However, Annie still longs to meet her parents.

Albert Finney, Carol Burnett, Bernadette Peters, John Huston

On his deathbed, Angelo promises to his dying father that he will leave the world of crime, and live an honest life. Although he has no experience in making money legally, he tries to keep his father’s promises.

Starring:

Sylvester Stallone, Marisa Tomei, Chazz Palminteri, Don Ameche, Kirk Douglas, Ornella Muti, Peter Riegert

15. Legend (1985)

20

9

PG

20

9

So as to cast the world into eternal night, Lord of Darkness has sent his goblins to kill the unicorns that live in the forest and guard the light. Meanwhile, impulsive Princess Lili has come to the forest to visit her lover Jack O'Greene and while frolicking, they unwittingly guide the goblins to the unicorns’ lair. Will the evil lord succeed in his plan?

Role:

Darkness

Starring:

Tom Cruise, Mia Sara, David Bennent, Alice Playten

Directed By:

16. The Three Musketeers (1993)

20

9

PG

20

9

Based on the 1844 novel of the same name, this comedy-drama film revolves around the adventures of d’Artagnan, on his quest to join the three titular characters in becoming a musketeer.

Starring:

17. Loaded Weapon 1 (1993)

15

9

PG-13

15

9

The satirical film features about-to-retire LAPD detective Wes Luger and worn-out cop Jack Colt who follow a trail of cookie crumbs to solve Luger’s former-partner’s murder. The trail leads them to Wilderness Girls cookie factory and mastermind Vietnam War veteran General Mortars and Jigsaw, who conspire to mix hard drug in cookies. The two must stop them before it is too late.

Role:

Mr. Jigsaw

Starring:

Samuel L. Jackson, Whoopi Goldberg, Denise Richards, Emilio Estevez, Denis Leary, F. Murray Abraham, Erik Estrada

Directed By:

Gene Quintano

18. The Ploughman's Lunch (1983)

6

6

R

6

6

The Ploughman’s Lunch is a 1983 drama film, which tells the story of a cunning journalist who tries his best to reach the top of his profession. However, he is unaware of the fact that he is being played on by others.

Starring:

Jonathan Pryce, Christopher Fulford, William Maxwell, Paul Jesson

Directed By:

Richard Eyre

8

8

R

8

8

8

PG-13

8

The Shadow is a superhero action adventure thriller film which revolves around the Shadow, a superhero, who battles against Shiwan Khan, who is planning to take over the world by holding a city hostage using an atomic bomb.

Starring:

Ian McKellen, Alec Baldwin, Penelope Ann Miller, Peter Boyle

Directed By:

Russell Mulcahy

21. The Secret of Moonacre (2008)

6

5

PG

6

5

Shortly after inheriting a book of secrets from her father, Maria moves to her uncle’s Moonacre estate. She soon comes to know that a curse was cast on the valley, and it lies upon her to free the cursed mansion before it disappears forever. However, she is unaware of the various obstacles that are standing in her way.

Role:

Starring:

23. Charlie's Angels (2000)

24

PG-13

24

18

Natalie, Dylan and Alex are three 'Angel' femmes fatales who work as private investigators for unseen millionaire Charlie to rescue kidnapped software genius Eric Knox and recover his revolutionary voice-recognition system. The three talented and attractive women, apart from utilizing their sex appeal, also employ various disguises, high-tech equipments, and martial arts to save the day.

Starring:

Drew Barrymore, Lucy Liu, Cameron Diaz, Bill Murray, Sam Rockwell, Crispin Glover, Luke Wilson

Directed By:

McG

25. Scary Movie 2 (2001)

20

17

TV-MA

20

17

The sequel to Scary Movie parodies a number of supernatural classics including The Haunting, The Exorcist, Poltergeist, The Changeling, The Legend of Hell House, and The Amityville Horror. It also takes on modern movies like Hannibal and Hollow Man and finds the lead characters in comedic-horrific situations spoofing actual sequences from the original movies.

Starring:

Marlon Wayans, Shawn Wayans, Regina Hall, David Cross, Natasha Lyonne, Anna Faris, Tori Spelling

Directed By:

26. Congo (1995)

9

8

PG-13

9

8

When tycoon R.B. Travis’s son and his diamond-exploring team goes missing in Congo, Travis sends his son’s ex-fiancée, Dr. Karen Ross, to look for them. Ross, with an expert guide, a primatologist, an explorer and a talking gorilla, sets out in search of Lost City of Zinj and diamond mines. But, what they encounter is far more dangerous than anything they imagined.

Role:

Herkermer Homolka

Starring:

Bruce Campbell, Joe Pantoliano, Laura Linney, Joe Don Baker, Ernie Hudson

Directed By:

Frank Marshall

Bruce Wayne is a millionaire businessman who lives in Gotham City, but people are unaware that at night, he assumes the role of a crime-fighting vigilante superhero: the caped crusader Batman. With the assistance of Robin and Barbara Gordon, daughter of Commissioner Gordon, he works to protect Gotham City from various criminals and lunatics such as The Joker and Killer Croc.

Neko no ongaeshi (2002)

34

G

34

13

High school student Haru Yoshioka saves a cat’s life and learns that he is Prince Lune of the Cat Kingdom. The Cat King invites her to marry Prince Lune, so Haru is taken to Cat Kingdom where she finds that she is turning into a cat.
